title: Daily added sugar intake in England in 2008 - 2012 , by age group
summary: This is a bar chart representing Age Group in the x axis and Sugar intake in grams in the y axis.
The Sugar intake in grams is appeared to be the highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
There is a difference of 38.1 between the maximum Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and minimum Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Age Group in the x axis and Sugar intake in grams in the y axis.
The maximum Sugar intake in grams 74.2 is found at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and the minimum is found at Children 1.5-3 years where Age Group is 36.1.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Age Group in the x axis and Sugar intake in grams in the y axis.
The Sugar intake in grams is appeared to be the highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
There is a difference of 38.1 between the maximum Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and minimum Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
max_summary: This is a bar chart. It shows Sugar intake in grams for 5 number of Age Groups.
The Sugar intake in grams is highest at Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and lowest at Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
The second highest Sugar intake in grams is appeared to be the Age Group Children 4-10 years.
There is a difference of 38.1 between the maximum Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years and minimum Age Group Children 1.5-3 years.
The Age Group Teenagers 11-18 years has the highest Sugar intake in grams, followed by Children 4-10 years, and Adults 19-64 years. Down to the Age Group Children 1.5-3 years which is the lowest.
The highest value 74.2 at Teenagers 11-18 years is almost 1.32 times larger than the average value 56.3.
The Sugar intake in grams is 281.5 if we add up values of all Age Groups.
